name: The St. Regis San Francisco

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night in September, room was very nice and spacious , bathroom very well equipped , view is beautiful , overall enjoyed my stay as you do you get more than other hotels at half the price
reviews.title: Very glamorous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would start with positives: the service was outstaning, pretty lobby, interesting drinks and dishes in the main restaurant, and a nice pool.
reviews.title: Not St Regis I expected

reviews.text: Negatives: the room I stayed was on a higher floor, the writing table looked beaten up, the mattress was making noises at every move (thankfully we only stayed two nights), no ironing board (you have to request one), you cannot get your own ice, also prepare to call for this.... Overall after staying at St Regis Bal Harbour the standard was set high, but even older St Regis in San Juan was much more relaxing, I forgot to mention the annoying door bell at odd hours that I could hear in my room every few hours. The entire room reminded me an akward design of Palace resorts in Mexico where I believe the price per week is the price per day or two at St Regis, glass bathroom door and opened bathroom concept is not exactly classy. I am writing this review as I am sitting in not so new BH Four Seasons and even though the place does not have a "wow" factor as St Regis Bal Harbour, it is completely in a different class (much higher one) than St Regis San Francisco. I would not stay in St Regis San Francisco again.
reviews.title: This is the best hotel!

reviews.text: St. Regis is by far the best hotel I've stayed at. The staff is super nice, Alway there for you. Close to everything. The lounge area is great for a drink with friends or family. I highly recommend this hotel if your budget permits.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and great experience

reviews.text: This was part of family trip to the San Francisco area. We had booked two connecting rooms but they upgraded us to a room connecting to a suite which was beautiful. The combined accommodation was large and luxurious and we all felt that it was really striking. All the room and bathroom amenities are beautifully done and the hotel is reasonably new. Service at check in and with the concierge was great and they were generally very friendly and greeted us with smiles and tried to assist and be helpful! One night they took us to our dinner reservation with their Bentley which made the kids super excited! The "Butler" was a waste of time as we only saw him once and they did not check in on us or do anything really so not sure what they are for. The location was amazing and very convenient to all. Breakfast was painfully slow in their breakfast restaurant is not great as a venue as it felt as an after thought rather than a real restaurant. Their Michelin star restaurant was OK and not amazing. However, all in all a beautiful hotel and a great experience.
reviews.title: Classy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at this property several times and I've always had a great experience. It's become my go-to hotel in San Francisco, both on trips for business or pleasure. However, my most recent stay was disappointing and I think I'll be looking to try a couple of other hotels on future trips to San Francisco. My wife and I were there for two nights. When we checked in, I asked the person at the desk if she could put me in the same room type as last time. She looked back through my recent stays to figure it out. A couple of minutes later, she asked "Is this your first time at the hotel?" I get that this is the equivalent of the "did you find everything you were looking for?" question you get when you check out at the grocery store and you know the person isn't really interested in your response, but it's still not ideal. In any case, we did end up in the same room type, but this one was connected to another room and the person next door was on a phone call and we could literally hear every word of her conversation in our room. We asked to be moved. We were taken to a room a level up that clearly wasn't the same room type and had a layout we didn't love. They offered one more room on the 15th floor, but it was filthy -- there was a patch of carpet missing, the writing desk was stained, and the windows looked as if they hadn't been washed...ever. To top it off, we were told there was construction nearby (not sure why we weren't told that on the original room, which was a door away but even lower, but never mind that). Needless to say, we went back to the second room we'd been offered. However, the thermostat didn't work. A very nice woman from engineering fixed it. When I took a shower that night, I realized that the rain shower wasn't working right -- it was mostly dipping. At this point, I was so tired of complaining and looking like a difficult customer that I just let it go.
reviews.title: Starting to show some cracks in the armor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In general, this is still a very nice hotel and the service is very good for the most part. However, I do think it's starting to show some serious wear and tear and needs to be freshened up if it truly wants to be thought of as an elite hotel over the long term. I should add that I've never been terribly impressed with Vitrine, the breakfast and lunch restaurant. It's tucked away on the 4th floor in an odd location and it's next to an outdoor venue space that always looks like it's in a state of disarray. I don't believe the breakfast menu has changed much (if at all) in the 3-4 years I'v been going.
reviews.title: Best Starwood Option in SF - Great Hotel

reviews.text: After staying at all the Starwood hotel options in SF over the year, this one definitely stands out. Rooms are well done and clean. Service is impeccable. Tough to argue it is one of the best hotels in the city.
reviews.title: Nice bar, lot's of straight shy men

reviews.text: After staying at all the Starwood hotel options in SF over the year, this one definitely stands out. Rooms are well done and clean. Service is impeccable. Tough to argue it is one of the best hotels in the city.
reviews.title: Welcoming

reviews.text: The hotel rooms are gorgeous and comfy. The baths are nice as well. There are lots of places to eat an the location is central so this hotel is a great home base.
reviews.title: Still Amazing!!

reviews.text: As expected, service was top notch for this centrally located hotel. Staff could not be more pleasant, helpful and respectful. Rooms were well appointed, clean and luxurious. Soundproofing also great as there was a concert below and we barely heard it. Best burger I've ever had.....but you might hope so for the price you pay. Overall, a great hotel if you are looking to spend more to get more.
reviews.title: Outstanding service

reviews.text: We cap off our summer vacation with a night at the St. Regis. It is a beautifully decorated hotel with a zen atmosphere and good service. Although very expensive I love this hotel and its location. Concierge and spa were very responsive.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel
Great location. A bit too impersonal.
reviews.text: Ok so this is a business hotel but the feel of St Regis is a touch too clinical and business-y. Encapsulated by the fact you have to pay 15$ for 24hrs of wifi which is a ridiculous starwood policy. Also be aware that the spa is separate so you are charged $20 for use of that too. I am not a cheapskate and have stayed in many top hotels across Europe and these two 'extras' leave a sour taste given the room rates and status of this hotel. Especially in a world where any coffee shop offers free wifi. In the plus side the view was fantastic, the bathroom huge and the bat always busy which have it a good ambience. Be aware rooms don't have much cupboard space which is odd.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Earlier this month I took my first-ever trip to San Francisco, where I ended up staying at the St. Regis. Now, I do not normally stay at St. Regises because they are expensive. The starting rate for the one we stayed at, according to Expedia, is $700. But we did not pay $700, not even close, because we used a friend’s Starwood (which owns the St. Regis brand) employee discount program.
reviews.title: Wonderful service but beware the construction

reviews.text: So what does $700 a night get you?
reviews.title: Shaky start but delivered in the end

reviews.text: While there is nothing about this hotel that will make you say "WOW!", I admire the sheer professionalism of the staff, the modern decor, and the peacefulness of the hotel. While the views and outdoor space at the Vitale are certainly better, the noisy pick up scene and hit or miss service that goes along with it always makes me think twice about returning. Corner rooms on high floors at the St Regis offer enough of a city view, as well as a degree of privacy, to remind you that you are not staying in a generic chain hotel. The indoor lap pool, which is rarely busy, is a major draw for me. Location might not be to everyone's liking, but Uber can usually get a car there within 10 minutes and cut out the San Fran taxi hassle. If you want a reliable hotel where everything works and you'll get a quiet night's sleep, the St Regis is for you.
reviews.title: Quiet and Reliable

reviews.text: Here's what I loved:
reviews.title: Unstuffy luxury AND chicken soup!

reviews.text: - Unstuffy and welcoming greetings from bell and door staff and even more from Daniela at the front desk. (Loved her asking a few questions that allowed us to have a great conversation .. not "just" a check in. And I imagine if I'd wanted not to talk, she and others there would have recognized that and not done so.)
reviews.title: I love this hotel

reviews.text: - My room (1705) - on the park side - and so bright and open and comfortable. I wanted to move in -- or at least take some of the ideas home if we ever remodel our condo.
reviews.title: Wonderful city hotel

reviews.text: - GREAT high-speed internet service (and yes, at a cost but it worked superbly), desk, desk light. Lots of outlets on the desk. The room also has a 'master control' next to the bed to raise and lower the window shades (room darkening and other roman shades), turn on and off the lights, and even the DND on the door. It was a help. I would like the bedside lamps to be a bit brighter for reading but with other lamps on and easily able to be turned off w/o getting out of bed, it was fine.
reviews.title: The best customer service. Period.

reviews.text: The rooms are nice enough, but in no way worth more than Westin. The staff was rude, dis-engaged and the farthest thing from "customer service" focused I have experienced and I have traveled all over this country and am Platinum Starwood. Will not be returning.
reviews.title: When I pay $600 for a room, I would expect the staff to be friendly and attentive.

reviews.text: Three perfect days at the St.Regis, San Francisco!
reviews.title: Three Perfect Days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived a bit apprehensively  to stay for the first time at the St.Regis San Francisco for a three night stay after spending some  quality time at the Hotel Bel Air and  staying as a repeat guest at the Four Seasons  in Beverly Hills where the service was grand.However, this  particular hotel far exceeded my expectations and  in my opinion was much finer in the way of accommodations and service .In fact after conversing with the outstanding front desk supervisor,Alan Yee at check in,I was made to feel immediately like royalty.Alan is a very skilled ,polished and well  seasoned hospitality professional.A rare elegance these days , which  seems to be missing in many  American hotels where management and operators seem to be more concerned with their bottom line  rather than hospitality or service to the customer and GUEST.
reviews.title: best hotel ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a Starwood preferred  member and customer we were upgraded to an  ultra comfortable and spacious executive suite with nothing but the finest of furnishings and the latest of electronic gadgets.We were offered the services of a butler as well as  an unusual menu of luxury  baths in the large marble bath room with  offerings of Champagne,caviar and chocolates served by the butler.Very decadent and super luxurious if you want to  splurge and spoil yourself a bit.
reviews.title: My go to place in SF

reviews.text: The room's climate, drapery, blackout shades ,TV ,sound system ,and lighting were all controlled from a single  bedside touchpad.The bedding was outstanding a and I slept better then I have all  year at any other hotel. The restaurant and bar were superb as was the very chilled out yet luxurious lobby with its cool , modern and somewhat cozy, relaxing fireplace wall separating the room  and seating areas.The hotel is very well located and within easy walking distance to almost anywhere you would want to go to in San Francisco.The bell staff  ,housekeeping staff and concierges were superb and their restaurant and local suggestions were on point.As a frequent business and leisure traveller I rate this hotel a true five star and will be sure to recommend it to others.I would even go so far to say that this was my finest hotel stay of the year and I am a fairly critical traveler  and customer.
reviews.title: Top-Notch Service

reviews.text: I booked a Premier Corner Room at the St Regis San Francisco, having stayed here before a few times before. I managed to negotiate a special pre-paid rate with the reservations manager. Unfortunately, the hotel over-charged to my credit card by a significant amount and did not even realize it until I raised it with the revenue management supervisor! Hence, there was the hassle of having to credit back the amount to my credit card. That took a while to sort out.
reviews.title: A Series of Errors ... Beware!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival at the hotel, I was allocated a room that was NOT the Premier (Corner) Room, but one category lower! I did not even realize this until I checked on the hotel website and verified with the front desk receptionist. No apology was given and all that was communicated to me was that there was a mistake and misunderstanding on their part.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: This is supposed to be a professionally run and managed hotel and its the St Regis for goodness sake! I was quite shocked and very disappointed with the entire series of mishaps and errors. After having stayed in this hotel twice before, I doubt that I will ever return again. The errors made leave a very bad "after taste", and I would caution anyone who is looking for a high end hotel to stay here.
reviews.title: Arrived with no preconceived notions but left a #1 fan!

reviews.text: The St. Regis is a beautiful Hotel. It is well located, hip, clean, without being pretentious. It is exactly what you would expect for the price. The service was excellent, best described as attentive but not smothering. We did not have a drink at the bar in the lobby but it was busy and looked appealing.
reviews.title: Sleek bug hotel with boutique feel
Fantastic when I was there but....
reviews.text: We just returned from a wonderful 10 day stay at the gorgeous St. Regis in San Francisco.

My family and I stayed at the St. Regis in San Francisco for 6 days and 5 nights. We had a room with a city view on the 18th floor. Since I was traveling with my wife and my 2 boys, 8 and 11 years old we got a room with 2 queen size beds.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Service

reviews.text: We recently spent a week at the St. Regis San Francisco (my wife and two sons 17 and 20). I can honestly say that my stay was one of the best experiences I have encountered in years. The service was impeccable, rooms magnificent, and location is within walking distance of shopping, dining, Moscone Center, and sights. San Francisco is one of the great destinations of the world and as such has its share of world class hotels; The St. Regis ranks as one of the finest anywhere. The rooms are modern, sleek, high tech, and clean; some rooms having magnificent views of the bay and city. As mentioned in other reviews, you really don't want to leave. We were treated as would be expected in a 5 star hotel without stuffiness or insincere over the top attentiveness, while at the same time, being responsive and attentive to our needs when expected. They refer to you by name, and to me, though not essential, is always impressive. If you like old world decor, this is probably not the place for you. The decor is very modern, with a Zen quality; light, simple lines, fresh, natural, peaceful. The bathrooms are luxurious, and bedrooms, though not huge, are spacious and comfortable. The beds are comfortable and fabrics rich. The most impressive thing (though when you first arrive it seems austere and cold), the staff is warm and attentive, and the Hotel's attention to subtle details, creats an intimate hotel experience, much different than what you get from the large, impersonal business hotels. The hotel meets and exceeds expections, and although not inexpensive, you don't feel cheated, we felt that we paid for superior service, decor, and quality, and we received it. Overall a great experience, as I look forward to our next visit.
reviews.title: Great Hotel experience at teh St. Regis

reviews.text: While I live in San Francisco, I decided to spend the weekend at the hotel as an escape. It was a great experience-a quite luxurious oasis--with great service and a modern but not austere design. Would highly recommend for a stress reducing experience.
reviews.title: great escape

reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel, as you would expect for the price. Great & very helpful staff. Comfy rooms, nice linens. 42" Flat panel TVs are nice, but it seems odd to not have HDTV broadcasts (as major city where every network broadcasts in HD). The meeting/dining facilities were very elegant. But the one complaint I had was being awakened by the very strong smell of cooking onions from the restaurant on the 4th floor-I was on the 5th facing the alley. Made it difficult to go back to sleep. This was not a case of a window being open, but it was being sucked into the ventilation system. Fairly quiet in terms of interior noise and street sounds. In room DVD/CD player, fax and printer are all nice touches. Great overhead shower. Bathroom only had a single sink, and no full length mirror, so it was difficult for 2 people to get ready at the same time. Conveniently located to shopping, movies and museums. Another tip, on the guest room floor there 3 elevators on each side, the first on each side have separate buttons from the other 4 and from what we could see the first never worked during our stay, yet no signs of them being out of service, they may have been some kind of special/VIP elevator, but you didn't know that as you stood waiting for the elevator that would never come. My tip ask for a high floor, and don't plan on watching TV, get out check out the city.
reviews.title: Wake and smell the onions
Can we move in please?
reviews.text: My boyfriend recently took me to the St. Regis as a romantic Valentine's Day surprise - although we both frequently stay in excellent hotels for business, we immediately loved the St. Regis! We had a corner suite in the 18th floor with wall to wall views of the city. The plasma TVs were great, as well as the rain showerhead. The luxurious bedding, towels and bath products were all top notch. The gym was also a nice surprise with all the latest TechnoGym equipment.

The hotel is within walking distance of Chinatown (for dim sum) and Union Square for shopping. There's also a restaurant downstairs, Ame - which is quite reasonably priced and has homey and innovative Japanese cuisine. We couldn't have asked for a better weekend!
reviews.title: I seriously considered moving in...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the St. Regis for four nights over the Labor day weekend and it was terrific. The staff were exceptionally accomodating, the lobby and bar area are very open and comfortable and the hotel has an overall calming feel to it. The rooms are very nicely appointed with great views of the city. You could hear some noise in the room at night if there were sirens etc but nothing major and we were not that high up in the building.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in a perfect location

reviews.text: The hotel is very modern with allot of glass, steel, clean lines etc, a real difference from the St. Regis in NYC where everything is very traditional. However all the features of a luxury hotel are present.
reviews.title: 5th or 6th trip

reviews.text: The bell men were great and very helpful. Be sure to take advantage of the butler service and the complimentary Bentley if you are going less than two miles from the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice City Hotel

reviews.text: Overall a terrific experience.
reviews.title: A Home Away from Home!

reviews.text: We always end our summer trip to Tahoe with a stay in the beautiful St. Regis before heading home to NYC. We are a family of four and the corner suites work great for us. The hotel is beautifully appointed and well situated in the city.
reviews.title: Expected more

reviews.text: This is a stunning property where all your cares will be forgotten. We received an upgrade to a delux something room that was beautiful. All appointments were top notch. Restaurant Ame was delicious and wine director John Vuong is a master of wine and sake pairing - thank you John. Things are expensive ($50/day parking and $20 in room small cheese pizza) but worth it. When you call to order room service and the phone is answered with someone repeating your name, order, time you call and the time your food will be delivered it's impressive. The staff cares and it shows with every interaction. Thank you.
reviews.title: St Regis delivers again

reviews.text: Decided I wanted a change of pace and booked here for 3 nights. I even upgraded myself to a corner room. They gave me a nice room on the 15th floor with the best view available considering the location of the building. I've been to SF many times before and always stay in the same general area.
reviews.title: Very nice but only if you need your hand kissed
Happy place in San Francisco
reviews.text: Even though my room had my all time favourite hotel luxury, a separate shower, I was still not all that impressed. Perhaps because my all time hotel pet peeve is a bathroom open to the bedroom, where even though there were doors that fully closed and covered the bathroom, I still knew it was an open concept.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great, right on Mission and Third. The greeting was St. Regis excellent, although unlike vacation properties, this city property didn't have individual desks, just a central check in counter. The agent walked out from behind the counter and walked me to the elevators chatting about the hotel the entire time, which was appreciated.
reviews.title: Impeccable rooms, impeccable service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My corner room was not huge but certainly acceptable. The drapes over the large picture window did not fully cover the window and the all night neon shone right on the bed. There was a ton of storage for clothes etc.
reviews.title: Baseball experience
Remede spa
reviews.text: be careful when signing the receipt at the St Regis spa Remede.... they slam an automatic 20% tip onto any fees... they don't suggest... they just add it....WHAM!!

reviews.title: Fabulous Color Palette
reviews.text: This option should be open on the receipt for the customer to add at will.... kind of a crass bit on their part at the end of the experience.

The color choices of this new luxury hotel are fabulous, as is their art collection. It is 1/2 block from the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, and we chose a package that included free tickets. The hotel is also a 20 minute walk from the new attraction -- the Ferry Building -- with its many food shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: My small complaints? When we arrived mid-morning and I asked where I could get a cappuccino I was directed outside to a nearby Starbucks. I expect a hotel of this caliber to have this available in their bar area. If they can make a Bloody Mary, they can make coffee. My other complaint is the lobby bar which "misses" somehow. This bar is a big vacuous room, lacking warmth and congeniality. The tables aren't convenient for your drinks, and beware sitting near the "fireplace" feature. It looks lovely, but the outside doors are directly behind it and the chill from them is not pleasant.
reviews.title: The Fabulous St. Regis

aka: St. Regis Hotel, San Francisco Hotel
description: The luxurious St. Regis San Francisco also has the Museum of the African Diaspora located within the hotel and the renowned San Francisco Museum of Modern Art next door.
